column2: The hypodermic outfit was there, but minus the phial.
column3: The hypodermic outfit was there, but minus the phial.

column2: In the alleyway rose a confusion of running feet and shouting tongues. A heavy banging rang on the door to Stateroom 29.
column3: In the alleyway rose a confusion of running feet and shouting tongues. A heavy banging rang on the door to Stateroom twenty nine.

column2: Crane's nasal accents called upon Lanyard to open.
column3: Crane's nasal accents called upon Lanyard to open.

column2: VIII
column3: eight

column2: OFF NANTUCKET
column3: OFF NANTUCKET

column2: Upon the authors of that commotion Lanyard wasted no consideration whatever.
column3: Upon the authors of that commotion Lanyard wasted no consideration whatever.

column2: Let them knock and clamour; he had more urgent work in hand, and knew too well the penalty were he stupid enough to unbolt to them.
column3: Let them knock and clamour; he had more urgent work in hand, and knew too well the penalty were he stupid enough to unbolt to them.

column2: Their bodies would dam the doorway hopelessly; insistent hands would hinder him; innumerable importunate enquiries would be dinned at him, all immaterial in contrast with this emergency, a catechism one would need an hour to satisfy.
column3: Their bodies would dam the doorway hopelessly; insistent hands would hinder him; innumerable importunate enquiries would be dinned at him, all immaterial in contrast with this emergency, a catechism one would need an hour to satisfy.

column2: And all attempts would be futile to make them understand that, while they plagued him with futile questions, a murderer and spy and thief was making good his escape, being afforded ample opportunity to slough all traces of his recent work and resume unchallenged his place among them.
column3: And all attempts would be futile to make them understand that, while they plagued him with futile questions, a murderer and spy and thief was making good his escape, being afforded ample opportunity to slough all traces of his recent work and resume unchallenged his place among them.

column2: No; if by any freak of good fortune, any exertion of wit or daring, that one were to be apprehended, it must be within the next few minutes, it could only be through immediate pursuit.
column3: No; if by any freak of good fortune, any exertion of wit or daring, that one were to be apprehended, it must be within the next few minutes, it could only be through immediate pursuit.

column2: Nor did the adventurer waste time debating the better course.
column3: Nor did the adventurer waste time debating the better course.

column2: With him, whose ways of life were ceaselessly beset by instant and mortal perils, each with its especial and imperative demand upon his readiness and ingenuity, action must ever press so hard upon the heels of thought as to make the two seem one.
column3: With him, whose ways of life were ceaselessly beset by instant and mortal perils, each with its especial and imperative demand upon his readiness and ingenuity, action must ever press so hard upon the heels of thought as to make the two seem one.

column2: For that matter, the whole transaction had been characterised by almost unbelievable rapidity.
column3: For that matter, the whole transaction had been characterised by almost unbelievable rapidity.

column2: And that square opening of the window-port was hardly vacant when Lanyard sprang to his feet; the fugitive had barely time to find his own upon the outer deck before Lanyard leaped after him; the first thumps upon the panels of his door were still echoing when he thrust head and shoulders out of the port and began to pump the automatic at a shadow fleeing aft upon that narrow breadth of planking between rail and wall.
column3: And that square opening of the window port was hardly vacant when Lanyard sprang to his feet; the fugitive had barely time to find his own upon the outer deck before Lanyard leaped after him; the first thumps upon the panels of his door were still echoing when he thrust head and shoulders out of the port and began to pump the automatic at a shadow fleeing aft upon that narrow breadth of planking between rail and wall.

column2: Then, at the third shot, the automatic jammed upon a discharged shell.
column3: Then, at the third shot, the automatic jammed upon a discharged shell.

column2: Exasperated, the adventurer cast the weapon from him, shrugged hastily out of his unfastened coat and waistcoat, hitched tight his belt, and clambered through the port.
column3: Exasperated, the adventurer cast the weapon from him, shrugged hastily out of his unfastened coat and waistcoat, hitched tight his belt, and clambered through the port.

column2: Dropping to the deck, he turned in time to see the fugitive dart round the shoulder of the superstructure.
column3: Dropping to the deck, he turned in time to see the fugitive dart round the shoulder of the superstructure.

column2: As Lanyard gained the after rail of the promenade deck a man standing on the boat-deck at the head of the companion-ladder greeted him with pistol fire.
column3: As Lanyard gained the after rail of the promenade deck a man standing on the boat deck at the head of the companion ladder greeted him with pistol fire.

column2: He dodged back, untouched, and instantaneously devised a stratagem to cope with this untoward development.
column3: He dodged back, untouched, and instantaneously devised a stratagem to cope with this untoward development.

column2: Overhead, at the side, a lifeboat hung on its davits, ready for emergency launching, the gap in the rail which it filled when normally swung inboard spanned only by a length of line.
column3: Overhead, at the side, a lifeboat hung on its davits, ready for emergency launching, the gap in the rail which it filled when normally swung inboard spanned only by a length of line.

column2: And the darkness in the shadow of the boat was dense, an excellent screen.
column3: And the darkness in the shadow of the boat was dense, an excellent screen.

column2: Climbing upon the rail, Lanyard grasped the edge of the deck overhead and drew himself up undetected by his quarry, whom he espied still holding the head of the companion ladder, hidden from the bridge by the after deck-house, standing ready to shoot Lanyard should he attempt to renew the pursuit by that approach.
column3: Climbing upon the rail, Lanyard grasped the edge of the deck overhead and drew himself up undetected by his quarry, whom he espied still holding the head of the companion ladder, hidden from the bridge by the after deck house, standing ready to shoot Lanyard should he attempt to renew the pursuit by that approach.

column2: At the same time, "Karl" seemed mysteriously occupied with some object or objects in whose manipulation he was hampered to a degree by the necessity under which he laboured of holding his pistol ready and dividing his attention.
column3: At the same time, "Karl" seemed mysteriously occupied with some object or objects in whose manipulation he was hampered to a degree by the necessity under which he laboured of holding his pistol ready and dividing his attention.

column2: A man of good stature, broad at the shoulders, slender at the hips, he poised himself with athletic grace--the lower part of his face masked by what Lanyard took to be a dark silk handkerchief.
column3: A man of good stature, broad at the shoulders, slender at the hips, he poised himself with athletic grace-the lower part of his face masked by what Lanyard took to be a dark silk handkerchief.

column2: Lanyard heard him swearing in German.
column3: Lanyard heard him swearing in German.

column2: Then a brisk little spray of sparks jetted from the flint and steel of a patent cigar-lighter in the hands of the spy.
column3: Then a brisk little spray of sparks jetted from the flint and steel of a patent cigar lighter in the hands of the spy.

column2: And as Lanyard rose from his knees after ducking beneath the line, a stream of fatter sparks spat from the end of a fuse.
column3: And as Lanyard rose from his knees after ducking beneath the line, a stream of fatter sparks spat from the end of a fuse.

column2: The man leaned over the rail and cast a small black object to which the sputtering fuse was attached, down to the main deck.
column3: The man leaned over the rail and cast a small black object to which the sputtering fuse was attached, down to the main deck.

column2: As it struck midway between superstructure and stern it burst into brilliant flame, releasing upon the night an electric-blue glare that must have been visible from any point within the compass of the horizon.
column3: As it struck midway between superstructure and stern it burst into brilliant flame, releasing upon the night an electric blue glare that must have been visible from any point within the compass of the horizon.

column2: A yell of profane remonstrance saluted the light, and throughout the brief passage that followed Lanyard was conscious that pistols and rifles on the after deck below were making him and his antagonist their targets.
column3: A yell of profane remonstrance saluted the light, and throughout the brief passage that followed Lanyard was conscious that pistols and rifles on the after deck below were making him and his antagonist their targets.

column2: Before the German could face about, Lanyard, moving almost noiselessly in his bare feet, had covered more than half the intervening space.
column3: Before the German could face about, Lanyard, moving almost noiselessly in his bare feet, had covered more than half the intervening space.

column2: In another breath he might have had the fellow at a disadvantage.
column3: In another breath he might have had the fellow at a disadvantage.

column2: But the distance was too great.
column3: But the distance was too great.

column2: Twice the automatic blazed in his face as he closed in, the bullets clearing narrowly--or else he fancied that their deadly cold breath fanned his cheek.
column3: Twice the automatic blazed in his face as he closed in, the bullets clearing narrowly-or else he fancied that their deadly cold breath fanned his cheek.

column2: Then the spy's weapon in turn went out of action.
column3: Then the spy's weapon in turn went out of action.

column2: Half blinded, Lanyard clipped the man round the body and hugged him tight, exerting all his skill and strength to effect a throw.
column3: Half blinded, Lanyard clipped the man round the body and hugged him tight, exerting all his skill and strength to effect a throw.

column2: That effort failed; his onslaught was met with address and ability that all but matched his own.
column3: That effort failed; his onslaught was met with address and ability that all but matched his own.

column2: The animal he embraced had muscles like tempered springs and the cunning and fury of a wild beast in a trap.
column3: The animal he embraced had muscles like tempered springs and the cunning and fury of a wild beast in a trap.

column2: For a moment Lanyard was able to accomplish no more than to smother resistance in a rib-crushing embrace; no sooner did he relax it than all attempts to shift his hold were anticipated and met half way, forcing him back upon the defensive.
column3: For a moment Lanyard was able to accomplish no more than to smother resistance in a rib crushing embrace; no sooner did he relax it than all attempts to shift his hold were anticipated and met half way, forcing him back upon the defensive.

column2: Yet he was given little chance to prove himself the master.
column3: Yet he was given little chance to prove himself the master.

column2: The first phase of the struggle was still in contest when the rear door of the smoking room opened and a man stepped out, paused, summed up the situation in a glance, seized Lanyard from behind.
column3: The first phase of the struggle was still in contest when the rear door of the smoking room opened and a man stepped out, paused, summed up the situation in a glance, seized Lanyard from behind.

column2: The adventurer felt his arms grasped by hands whose strength seemed little short of superhuman, and wrenched back so violently that his very bones cracked.
column3: The adventurer felt his arms grasped by hands whose strength seemed little short of superhuman, and wrenched back so violently that his very bones cracked.

column2: Fairly lifted from his feet, he was held as helpless as an infant kicking in the arms of its nurse.
column3: Fairly lifted from his feet, he was held as helpless as an infant kicking in the arms of its nurse.

column2: Released, the other spy stepped back and swung his left fist viciously to Lanyard's jaw.
column3: Released, the other spy stepped back and swung his left fist viciously to Lanyard's jaw.

column2: Something in the brain of the adventurer seemed to let go; his head dropped weakly to one side.
column3: Something in the brain of the adventurer seemed to let go; his head dropped weakly to one side.

column2: The man who had struck him said quietly, "Loose the fool, Ed," and followed as Lanyard reeled away, striking him repeatedly.
column3: The man who had struck him said quietly, "Loose the fool, Ed," and followed as Lanyard reeled away, striking him repeatedly.

column2: For a giddy moment Lanyard was darkly conscious--as one dreams an evil dream--of blows raining mercilessly about his head and body, blows that drove him back athwartships toward a fate dark and terrible, a great void of blackness.
column3: For a giddy moment Lanyard was darkly conscious-as one dreams an evil dream-of blows raining mercilessly about his head and body, blows that drove him back athwartships toward a fate dark and terrible, a great void of blackness.

column2: He felt unutterably weary, and was weakened by a sensation of nausea.
column3: He felt unutterably weary, and was weakened by a sensation of nausea.

column2: Beneath him his knees buckled.
column3: Beneath him his knees buckled.

column2: There fell one final blow, ruthless as the wrath of God.
column3: There fell one final blow, ruthless as the wrath of God.

column2: He was falling backward into nothingness, into an everlasting gulf of night that yawned for him....
column3: He was falling backward into nothingness, into an everlasting gulf of night that yawned for him....

column2: As he shot under the guard rope and into space between the edge of the deck and the keel of the lifeboat, the spy rounded smartly on a heel and darted to the smoking-room door.
column3: As he shot under the guard rope and into space between the edge of the deck and the keel of the lifeboat, the spy rounded smartly on a heel and darted to the smoking room door.

column2: His confederate was in the act of stepping across the raised threshold.
column3: His confederate was in the act of stepping across the raised threshold.

column2: He followed, closed the door.
column3: He followed, closed the door.

column2: The first officer, charging aft from the bridge, rounded the deck-house and pulled up with a grunt of surprise to find the deck completely deserted....
column3: The first officer, charging aft from the bridge, rounded the deck house and pulled up with a grunt of surprise to find the deck completely deserted....

column2: The shock of icy immersion reanimated Lanyard.
column3: The shock of icy immersion reanimated Lanyard.

column2: He felt himself plunging headlong down, down, and down to inky depths unguessable.
column3: He felt himself plunging headlong down, down, and down to inky depths unguessable.

column2: The sheer habit of an accustomed swimmer alone bade him hold his breath.
column3: The sheer habit of an accustomed swimmer alone bade him hold his breath.

column2: Then came a pause: he was no more descending; for a time of indeterminate duration, an age of anguish, he seemed to float without motion, suspended in frigid purgatory.
column3: Then came a pause: he was no more descending; for a time of indeterminate duration, an age of anguish, he seemed to float without motion, suspended in frigid purgatory.

column2: Against his ribs something hammered like a racing engine.
column3: Against his ribs something hammered like a racing engine.

column2: In his ears sounded a vast roaring, the deafening voices of a thousand waterfalls.
column3: In his ears sounded a vast roaring, the deafening voices of a thousand waterfalls.

column2: His head felt swollen and enormous, on the point of bursting wide.
column3: His head felt swollen and enormous, on the point of bursting wide.

column2: Without warning expelled from those depths, he shot full half-length out of water, and fell back into the milky welter of the _Assyrian's_ wake.
column3: Without warning expelled from those depths, he shot full half length out of water, and fell back into the milky welter of the underscore Assyrian's underscore wake.

column2: Instinctively he kept afloat with feeble strokes.
column3: Instinctively he kept afloat with feeble strokes.

column2: The cold was bitter, as sharp as the teeth of death; but his head was now clear, he was able to appreciate what had befallen him.
column3: The cold was bitter, as sharp as the teeth of death; but his head was now clear, he was able to appreciate what had befallen him.

column2: Already the _Assyrian_, forging onward unchecked, had left him well astern, her progress distinctly disclosed by that infernal bluish glare spouting from her after deck.
column3: Already the underscore Assyrian underscore, forging onward unchecked, had left him well astern, her progress distinctly disclosed by that infernal bluish glare spouting from her after deck.

column2: She seemed absurdly small.
column3: She seemed absurdly small.

column2: Incredulity infected Lanyard's mind.
column3: Incredulity infected Lanyard's mind.

column2: Nothing so tiny, so insignificant, so make-believe as that silhouette of a ship could conceivably be that great liner, the _Assyrian_....
column3: Nothing so tiny, so insignificant, so make believe as that silhouette of a ship could conceivably be that great liner, the underscore Assyrian underscore....

column2: Temporarily a burning pain in his left shoulder drove all other considerations out of mind.
column3: Temporarily a burning pain in his left shoulder drove all other considerations out of mind.

column2: The salt water was beginning to smart in the raw, superficial wound made by that assassin's bullet ... back there in the stateroom ... long ago....
column3: The salt water was beginning to smart in the raw, superficial wound made by that assassin's bullet ... back there in the stateroom ... long ago....

column2: Then the cold began to bite into his marrow, and he struggled manfully to swim, taking long, slow strokes, at first comparatively powerful, by insensible degrees losing force.
column3: Then the cold began to bite into his marrow, and he struggled manfully to swim, taking long, slow strokes, at first comparatively powerful, by insensible degrees losing force.

column2: Just why he took this trouble he did not know: for some dim reason it seemed desirable to live as long as possible.
column3: Just why he took this trouble he did not know: for some dim reason it seemed desirable to live as long as possible.

column2: Withal he was aware he could not live.
column3: Withal he was aware he could not live.

column2: Whether careless or utterly ignorant of his fate, the _Assyrian_ was trudging on and on, leaving him ever farther astern, lost beyond rescue in that weird, bleak waste.
column3: Whether careless or utterly ignorant of his fate, the underscore Assyrian underscore was trudging on and on, leaving him ever farther astern, lost beyond rescue in that weird, bleak waste.

column2: Even were an alarm to be given, were she to stop now and put out a boat, it would find him, if it found him at all, too late.
column3: Even were an alarm to be given, were she to stop now and put out a boat, it would find him, if it found him at all, too late.

column2: The cold was killing.
column3: The cold was killing.

column2: He felt very sleepy.
column3: He felt very sleepy.

column2: Drowsily he apprehended the beginning of the end. His senses, growing numb with cold, presently must cease to function altogether.
column3: Drowsily he apprehended the beginning of the end. His senses, growing numb with cold, presently must cease to function altogether.

column2: Then he would forget, and nothing would matter any more.
column3: Then he would forget, and nothing would matter any more.

column2: Yet the will to live persisted amazingly.
column3: Yet the will to live persisted amazingly.

column2: Had Lanyard wished it he could not have ceased to swim, at least to keep afloat.
column3: Had Lanyard wished it he could not have ceased to swim, at least to keep afloat.

column2: Vaguely he wondered how people ever managed to commit suicide by drowning; it seemed to pass human power to resist that buoyancy which sustained one, to let go, let one's self go down.
column3: Vaguely he wondered how people ever managed to commit suicide by drowning; it seemed to pass human power to resist that buoyancy which sustained one, to let go, let one's self go down.

column2: Impossible to conceive how that was ever done....
column3: Impossible to conceive how that was ever done....

column2: Why should he care to go on living?
column3: Why should he care to go on living?

column2: No reading that riddle!...
column3: No reading that riddle!...

column2: On obscure impulse he gave up swimming, turned upon his back, floated face to the sky, derelict, resigning himself to the cradling arms of the sea. The gradual, slow rocking of the swells soothed his passion like a kindly opiate.
column3: On obscure impulse he gave up swimming, turned upon his back, floated face to the sky, derelict, resigning himself to the cradling arms of the sea. The gradual, slow rocking of the swells soothed his passion like a kindly opiate.

column2: The cold no more irked him, but seemed somehow strangely anodynous. Imperturbably he envisaged death, without fear, without welcome.
column3: The cold no more irked him, but seemed somehow strangely anodynous. Imperturbably he envisaged death, without fear, without welcome.

column2: What must be, must....
column3: What must be, must....

column2: For all that, life clutched at him with jealous hands.
column3: For all that, life clutched at him with jealous hands.

column2: More than ever sleepy, before he slept that last, long sleep he must somehow solve this enigma, learn the reason why life continued so to allure his failing senses.
column3: More than ever sleepy, before he slept that last, long sleep he must somehow solve this enigma, learn the reason why life continued so to allure his failing senses.

column2: Athwart the drab texture of consciousness wild fancies played like heat lightning in a still midsummer night.
column3: Athwart the drab texture of consciousness wild fancies played like heat lightning in a still midsummer night.

column2: Death's countenance was kind.
column3: Death's countenance was kind.

column2: That wide field of stars, drooping low and lifting away with rhythmic motion, would sometime dip swiftly down to the very sea itself and, swinging back, take with it his soul to some remote bourne....
column3: That wide field of stars, drooping low and lifting away with rhythmic motion, would sometime dip swiftly down to the very sea itself and, swinging back, take with it his soul to some remote bourne....

column2: The deeps were yielding up their mysteries.
column3: The deeps were yielding up their mysteries.

column2: Past him a huge pale monster swept at furious pace, hissing grimly as it passed, like some spectral Nemesis pursuing the _Assyrian_.
column3: Past him a huge pale monster swept at furious pace, hissing grimly as it passed, like some spectral Nemesis pursuing the underscore Assyrian underscore.

column2: Indifferently he speculated concerning the reality of this phenomenon.
column3: Indifferently he speculated concerning the reality of this phenomenon.

column2: The heave of a swell enabled him to glance incuriously after the steamship. She seemed smaller, less genuine than ever, a shadow shape that boasted visibility solely through that unearthly light on her after deck.
column3: The heave of a swell enabled him to glance incuriously after the steamship. She seemed smaller, less genuine than ever, a shadow shape that boasted visibility solely through that unearthly light on her after deck.

column2: Even that now had waned to a mere glimmer, the flicker of a candle lost in the immensities of that night-bound world of empty sky and empty ocean.
column3: Even that now had waned to a mere glimmer, the flicker of a candle lost in the immensities of that night bound world of empty sky and empty ocean.

column2: Even as he that had been named Michael Lanyard was a lost light, a tiny flame that guttered toward its swift extinction....
column3: Even as he that had been named Michael Lanyard was a lost light, a tiny flame that guttered toward its swift extinction....

column2: Why live, when one might die and, dying, find endless rest?
column3: Why live, when one might die and, dying, find endless rest?

column2: Like a blazing thunderbolt one word rent the slumbrous web of sentience: _Ekstrom_!
column3: Like a blazing thunderbolt one word rent the slumbrous web of sentience: underscore Ekstrom underscore!

column2: Galvanised by the flood of hatred unpent by the syllables of that name, Lanyard began again to swim, flailing the water with frantic arms as if to win somewhither by the very violence of his efforts.
column3: Galvanised by the flood of hatred unpent by the syllables of that name, Lanyard began again to swim, flailing the water with frantic arms as if to win somewhither by the very violence of his efforts.

column2: This the one cogent reason why he must not, could not, die....
column3: This the one cogent reason why he must not, could not, die....

column2: Unjust to require him to give up life while that one lived.
column3: Unjust to require him to give up life while that one lived.

column2: Unfair....
column3: Unfair....

column2: It must not be!...
column3: It must not be!...

column2: Across the sea rolled a dull, brutish detonation.
column3: Across the sea rolled a dull, brutish detonation.

column2: The swimmer, swung high on the bosom of a great swell, saw a vast sheet of fire raving heavenward from the _Assyrian_.
column3: The swimmer, swung high on the bosom of a great swell, saw a vast sheet of fire raving heavenward from the underscore Assyrian underscore.

column2: It vanished instantly.
column3: It vanished instantly.

column2: When his dazzled vision cleared, he could see no more of the ship.
column3: When his dazzled vision cleared, he could see no more of the ship.

column2: He imagined a faint, wild rumour of panic voices, conjured up scenes of horror indescribable as that great fabric sank almost instantaneously, as if some gigantic hand plucked her under.
column3: He imagined a faint, wild rumour of panic voices, conjured up scenes of horror indescribable as that great fabric sank almost instantaneously, as if some gigantic hand plucked her under.

column2: What had happened?
column3: What had happened?

column2: Had the accomplices of the dead Baron von Harden set off an infernal machine aboard the vessel?
column3: Had the accomplices of the dead Baron von Harden set off an infernal machine aboard the vessel?

column2: In the name of reason, why?
column3: In the name of reason, why?

column2: They had got what they sought, that accursed document, whatever it was, that page torn from the Book of Doom.
column3: They had got what they sought, that accursed document, whatever it was, that page torn from the Book of Doom.

column2: Then why...?
column3: Then why...?

column2: And to what end had they exploded that light bomb on the after deck?
column3: And to what end had they exploded that light bomb on the after deck?

column2: To make the _Assyrian_ a glaring target in the night--what else?
column3: To make the underscore Assyrian underscore a glaring target in the night-what else?

column2: A target for what?...
column3: A target for what?...

column2: Of a sudden all rational mental processes were erased from Lanyard's consciousness.
column3: Of a sudden all rational mental processes were erased from Lanyard's consciousness.

column2: A wave of pure fear flooded him, body, mind, and soul.
column3: A wave of pure fear flooded him, body, mind, and soul.

column2: He began to struggle like a maniac, fighting the waters that hindered his flight from some hideous thing that was lifting up from the ocean's ooze to drag him down.
column3: He began to struggle like a maniac, fighting the waters that hindered his flight from some hideous thing that was lifting up from the ocean's ooze to drag him down.

column2: He heard a voice screaming thinly, and knew it was his own.
column3: He heard a voice screaming thinly, and knew it was his own.

column2: The impossible was happening to him, out there, alone and helpless on the face of the waters.
column3: The impossible was happening to him, out there, alone and helpless on the face of the waters.

column2: A shape of horror was rising out of the deep to engorge him.
column3: A shape of horror was rising out of the deep to engorge him.

column2: He could feel distinctly the slow, irresistible heave of its bulk beneath him.
column3: He could feel distinctly the slow, irresistible heave of its bulk beneath him.

column2: His feet touched and slipped upon its horrible sleek flanks.
column3: His feet touched and slipped upon its horrible sleek flanks.

column2: His most desperate efforts were all unavailing.
column3: His most desperate efforts were all unavailing.

column2: He could not escape.
column3: He could not escape.

column2: The thing came up too rapidly.
column3: The thing came up too rapidly.

column2: Following that first mad thrill of contact with it underfoot, he was lifted swiftly and irresistibly into the air.
column3: Following that first mad thrill of contact with it underfoot, he was lifted swiftly and irresistibly into the air.

column2: Almost instantly he was floundering in knee-deep waters that parted, cascading away on either hand.
column3: Almost instantly he was floundering in knee deep waters that parted, cascading away on either hand.

column2: Then, elevated well above the sea, he slid and fell prone upon a slimy wet surface.
column3: Then, elevated well above the sea, he slid and fell prone upon a slimy wet surface.

column2: His clawing hands clutched something solid and substantial, an upright bar of metal.
column3: His clawing hands clutched something solid and substantial, an upright bar of metal.

column2: Incredulously Lanyard pawed the body of the monster beneath him.
column3: Incredulously Lanyard pawed the body of the monster beneath him.

column2: His hands passed over a riveted joint of metal plates.
column3: His hands passed over a riveted joint of metal plates.

column2: Looking up, he made out the truncated cone of a conning tower with its antennae-like periscope tubes stencilled black upon the soft purple of the star-strewn sky.
column3: Looking up, he made out the truncated cone of a conning tower with its antennae like periscope tubes stencilled black upon the soft purple of the star strewn sky.

column2: Slowly the truth came home: a submarine had risen beneath him.
column3: Slowly the truth came home: a submarine had risen beneath him.

column2: He lay upon its after deck, grasping a stanchion that supported the small raised bridge round the conning tower.
column3: He lay upon its after deck, grasping a stanchion that supported the small raised bridge round the conning tower.

column2: He sobbed a little in sheer hysteric gratitude, that this miracle had been vouchsafed unto him, that he had thus been spared to live on against his hour with Ekstrom.
column3: He sobbed a little in sheer hysteric gratitude, that this miracle had been vouchsafed unto him, that he had thus been spared to live on against his hour with Ekstrom.

column2: But when he sought to drag himself up to the bridge, he could not, he was too weak and faint.
column3: But when he sought to drag himself up to the bridge, he could not, he was too weak and faint.

column2: Ceasing to struggle, he rested in half stupour, panting.
column3: Ceasing to struggle, he rested in half stupour, panting.

column2: With a harsh clang a hatch was thrown back.
column3: With a harsh clang a hatch was thrown back.

column2: Rousing, Lanyard saw several figures emerge from the conning tower.
column3: Rousing, Lanyard saw several figures emerge from the conning tower.

column2: Men uncouthly clothed in shapeless, shiny leather garments, straddled and stretched above him, filling their lungs with the sweet air.
column3: Men uncouthly clothed in shapeless, shiny leather garments, straddled and stretched above him, filling their lungs with the sweet air.

column2: He tried to call to them, but evoked a mere rattle from his throat.
column3: He tried to call to them, but evoked a mere rattle from his throat.

column2: Two came to the edge of the bridge and stood immediately over him, fixing binoculars to their eyes, their voices quite audible.
column3: Two came to the edge of the bridge and stood immediately over him, fixing binoculars to their eyes, their voices quite audible.

column2: A pang of despair shot through Lanyard when he heard them conferring together in the German tongue.
column3: A pang of despair shot through Lanyard when he heard them conferring together in the German tongue.

column2: Death, then, was but a little delayed.
column3: Death, then, was but a little delayed.

column2: Thereafter he lay in dumb apathy, save that he shivered and his teeth chattered uncontrollably.
column3: Thereafter he lay in dumb apathy, save that he shivered and his teeth chattered uncontrollably.

column2: Through the torpor that rested like a black cloud upon his senses he caught broken phrases, snatches of sentences:
column3: Through the torpor that rested like a black cloud upon his senses he caught broken phrases, snatches of sentences:

column2: ... _sinking fast ... struck square amidships ... broke her back_....
column3: ... underscore sinking fast ... struck square amidships ... broke her back underscore....

column2: ... _trouble with her boats.	... underscore trouble with her boats.
column3: false

column2: There goes one over_!..."
column3: There goes one over underscore!..."

column2: ... _fools jumping overboard like cattle_....
column3: ... underscore fools jumping overboard like cattle underscore....

column2: _What's that rocket?	underscore What's that rocket?
column3: false

column2: Do the swine want us to shell their boats_?"
column3: Do the swine want us to shell their boats underscore?"

column2: _Why not?	underscore Why not?
column3: false

column2: They're asking for it_!"
column3: They're asking for it underscore!"

column2: One of the officers lowered his glasses and barked a series of sharp commands.
column3: One of the officers lowered his glasses and barked a series of sharp commands.

column2: The crew on deck leaped to attention.
column3: The crew on deck leaped to attention.

column2: One leaned over the conning-tower hatch and shouted to his mates below.
column3: One leaned over the conning tower hatch and shouted to his mates below.

column2: A hatch forward of the tower opened, and a quick-firing gun on a disappearing carriage swung smoothly and silently up from its lair.
column3: A hatch forward of the tower opened, and a quick firing gun on a disappearing carriage swung smoothly and silently up from its lair.

column2: The other officer, looking down, started violently.
column3: The other officer, looking down, started violently.

column2: _Verdammt_!	underscore Verdammt underscore!
column3: false

column2: What's this?"
column3: What's this?"

column2: The first rejoined him.
column3: The first rejoined him.

column2: Impossible!
column3: Impossible!

column2: Impossible or not--a man or a cadaver!
column3: Impossible or not-a man or a cadaver!

column2: Have him up and see....
column3: Have him up and see....

column2: By order, two of the crew dragged Lanyard up to the bridge, supporting him by main strength while the officers examined him.
column3: By order, two of the crew dragged Lanyard up to the bridge, supporting him by main strength while the officers examined him.

column2: At the last gasp, but alive, one announced.
column3: At the last gasp, but alive, one announced.

column2: How the devil did he get out here?
column3: How the devil did he get out here?

column2: From the _Assyrian_--
column3: From the underscore Assyrian underscore--

column2: Impossible for any man to swim this far since our torpedo struck--
column3: Impossible for any man to swim this far since our torpedo struck-

column2: Then he must have gone overboard before it struck--or was thrown--
column3: Then he must have gone overboard before it struck-or was thrown-

column2: A cry of alarm from the group about the gun, awaiting final orders to open fire upon the _Assyrian's_ boats, interrupted the conference.
column3: A cry of alarm from the group about the gun, awaiting final orders to open fire upon the underscore Assyrian's underscore boats, interrupted the conference.

column2: The officers swung away in haste.
column3: The officers swung away in haste.

column2: Hell's fury!	Hell's fury!
column3: true

column2: what's that searchlight?"
column3: what's that searchlight?"

column2: A Yankee destroyer--in all probability the one we dodged yesterday afternoon.
column3: A Yankee destroyer-in all probability the one we dodged yesterday afternoon.

column2: She'll find us yet if we don't submerge.	She'll find us yet if we don't submerge.
column3: false

column2: Forward, there--house that gun! And get below--quickly!"
column3: Forward, there-house that gun! And get below-quickly!"

column2: During a moment of apparent confusion, one of the men sustaining Lanyard caught the attention of an officer.
column3: During a moment of apparent confusion, one of the men sustaining Lanyard caught the attention of an officer.

column2: What shall we do with this fellow, sir? he enquired.
column3: What shall we do with this fellow, sir? he enquired.

column2: Leave him here to sink or swim as we go down, snapped the officer--"and be damned to him!"
column3: Leave him here to sink or swim as we go down, snapped the officer-"and be damned to him!"

column2: With a supreme effort the adventurer sank his fingers deep into the arms of the two men.
column3: With a supreme effort the adventurer sank his fingers deep into the arms of the two men.

column2: Wait! he gasped faintly in German.
column3: Wait! he gasped faintly in German.

column2: On the Emperor's service--
column3: On the Emperor's service-

column2: What's that?
column3: What's that?

column2: The officer turned back sharply.
column3: The officer turned back sharply.

column2: Imperial Secret Service, Lanyard faltered--"Personal Division--Wilhelmstrasse Number 27--"
column3: Imperial Secret Service, Lanyard faltered-"Personal Division-Wilhelmstrasse Number twenty seven--"

column2: A brilliant glare settled suddenly upon the deck of the submarine, and was welcomed by a panicky gust of oaths.
column3: A brilliant glare settled suddenly upon the deck of the submarine, and was welcomed by a panicky gust of oaths.

column2: One officer had already popped through the conning-tower hatch, followed by several of the crew.
column3: One officer had already popped through the conning tower hatch, followed by several of the crew.

column2: There remained only those supporting Lanyard, and the second officer.
column3: There remained only those supporting Lanyard, and the second officer.

column2: Take him below! the latter ordered.
column3: Take him below! the latter ordered.

column2: He may be telling the truth.	He may be telling the truth.
column3: true

column2: If not...."
column3: If not...."

column2: In the distance a gun boomed.
column3: In the distance a gun boomed.

column2: A shell shrieked over the submarine and dropped into the sea not a hundred yards to starboard.
column3: A shell shrieked over the submarine and dropped into the sea not a hundred yards to starboard.

column2: The men rushed Lanyard toward the conning tower.
column3: The men rushed Lanyard toward the conning tower.

column2: He tried feebly to help them.
column3: He tried feebly to help them.

column2: In that effort consciousness was altogether blotted out....
column3: In that effort consciousness was altogether blotted out....
